thread.title: Which former Braves you’ll see play at SunTrust Park
thread.title_full: Which former Braves you’ll see play at SunTrust Park

author: AJC Sports
title: Which former Braves you’ll see play at SunTrust Park
text:
The Atlanta Braves have been busy trade partners over the last few seasons.
The Braves will open SunTrust Park in Cobb County April 14, 2017 , against the San Diego Padres.
Atlanta Braves 2017 sortable schedule
A number of major league clubs have former Braves and players who hail from Georgia on their rosters. Here’s a look at the players with Georgia ties you may be able to spot on the field playing for the opposition (teams listed by dates on schedule) :
San Diego Padres Christian Petersen/Getty Images San Diego Padres, April 14-17: Former Braves catcher Christian Bethancourt (above) returns to Atlanta for home opener series. Other former Braves on Padres roster include pitchers Jhoulys Chacin, Ryan Buchter, Trevor Cahill and Tyrell Jenkins.
SunTrust Park tailgating rules
St. Louis Cardinals Kevin Liles/Getty Images St. Louis Cardinals, May 5-7: John Gant (above) made his pitching debut with the Braves last season. He is one of at least five Cardinals -- Dexter Fowler, Adam Wainwright, Jonathan Broxton and Stephen Drew -- with roots in Georgia.
Toronto Blue Jays Vaughn Ridley/Getty Images Tornoto Blue Jays, May 17-18: Reliever Jason Grilli recovered from a torn achilles in 2015 and pitched for the Braves in 2016 before being traded to Toronto. Also on the roster is former Braves outfielder Melvin Upton Jr. (above), who spent two seasons in Atlanta.
Pittsburgh Pirates Jennifer Stewart/Getty Images Pittsburgh Pirates, May 22-25: Pittsburgh acquired former Braves infielder Phil Gosselin (above) during the offseason. The Pirates also include Athens native Adam Frazier in the lineup.
New photos inside SunTrust Park
Miami Marlins Justin K. Aller/Getty Images Miami Marlins, June 16-18; Aug. 4-6; Sept. 7-10: Martin Prado made his major-league debut with the Braves in 2006. He's spent the last two seasons in Miami. He is joined on the Marlins' roster with former Braves reliever Hunter Cervenka. The team also includes former Georgia Tech pitcher Jake Esch.
San Francisco Giants Thearon W. Henderson/Getty Images San Francisco Giants, June 19-22: Pitcher Cory Gearrin (above, who also played at Mercer) pitched three seasons in Atlanta. The Giants also have catcher Buster Posey, of Lee County, and pitcher Hunter Strickland, of Thomaston, on the roster.
Milwaukee Brewers Rob Tringali/Getty Images Milwaukee Brewers, June 23-25: Pitcher Neftali Feliz was part of the trade that helped the Braves acquire Mark Teixeira in 2007.
Houston Astros Hannah Foslien/Getty Images Houston Astros, July 4-5: Catchers Evan Gattis (above), and Brian McCann are joined by former Braves pitcher Charlie Morton on the Astros roster. Josh Reddick, a native of Savannah, also plays for the Astros.
Arizona Diamondbacks Jennifer Stewart/Getty Images Arizona Diamondbacks, July 14-16: Shelby Miller (above) was traded to the Diamondbacks for prospect Dansby Swanson after one season in Atlanta. Randall Delgado pitched in Atlanta in 2011-12.
Chicago Cubs Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images Chicago Cubs, July 17-19: Cubs Outfielder Jason Heyward (above), of McDonough, spent five seasons with the Braves. Infielder Tommy La Stella played in 93 games for Atlanta in 2014.
Los Angeles Dodgers Doug Pensinger/Getty Images Los Angeles Dodgers, Aug. 1-3: Dodgers pitcher Alex Wood (above), who pitched at Georgia, made his major league debut with the Braves in 2013. Georgians Charlie Culberson, who played high school baseball at Calhoun, and Andrew Toles, who played at Sandy Creek, are on the roster.
Cincinnati Reds Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images Cincinnati Reds, Aug 18-20: Outfielder Jose Peraza, who the Braves signed as a free agent in 2010, made his major league debut with the Reds in 2015 after he was acquired in a three-team trade that dealt Alex Wood to Los Angeles and sent Hector Olivera to Atlanta. Atlanta native Blake Wood (above) pitched at North Gwinnett High School and Georgia Tech.
Seattle Mariners Doug Pensinger/Getty Images Seattle Mariners, Aug. 21-23: Shae Simmons pitched for the Braves in 2014.
Texas Rangers Bob Levey/Getty Images Texas Rangers, Sept. 4-6: Lucas Harrell (above) started five games for the Braves in 2015. Shortstop Elvis Andrus was signed by the Braves in 2005 and traded to Texas in 2007 for Mark Teixeira. Outfielder and designated hitter Delino DeShields Jr. is from Norcross.
